pages.text: On top of wearable apparel, there are also many blocks and other such items connected to demons.

pages.title: Nethersteel
pages.text: A strange semi-metallic material. It feels warm, almost as if alive… This material is too... capricious to be shaped into tools, but can often be shaped into decorative blocks and idols. It’s also critical in creating many demonic baubles. This dubious substance is created as follows:

pages.title: Scorned Bricks
pages.text: No matter the climate, this red-tinted slaty stone is always as cold as the night. If you press your ear to it, you can swear you hear cries and screams… This material is believed to be used by demons to build their great palaces hidden beyond the angles of time, and can be created using the Hellworld brew on Embittered Bricks, as well as follows:

pages.title: Despair Bricks
pages.text: Sometimes seen in the wastes of the many hells, these ochre bricks are often associated with desolate wastes, where no soul receives any warmth from any light, and thus, rots for all eternity. The structures that dot these landscapes were believed to have been made by demons long-gone, and yet their recipe is as is:

pages.title: Statue
pages.text: Statues are large figures of major demons. They can be placed around statues, granting a boon, and sometimes, the favor of the demon itself.

pages.title: Leonard
pages.text: Leonard is known as being the King of the Witches.

pages.title: Baphomet
pages.text: Beware the Templars and their Goat idolatory.

pages.title: Lilith
pages.text: The Mistress of The Night feeds on the blood of men.

pages.title: Herne
pages.text: Hunter Orion believes he can hunt all.

pages.title: idol
pages.text: Idols are small effigies of a demon, often placed on altars by willing demonolators, who worship these infernal beings.
